name: Tunneling
description: On every UCLA students' bucketlist- Miles of steam tunnels underneath the campus. Maintenance has been sealing off entrances, but you can still find some around. Destinations to visit include the YRL underground library, Macgowan prop room, Chem lab storage, Pauley, Underground bridge

name: Royce Towers
description: Find your way in and enjoy a view from one of UCLA's most iconic buildings. Flashlight recommended.

name: Powell Rotunda
description: If you're lucky and the door's unlocked, you'll have to squeeze up a narrow ladder and walk on sketchy planks to get here. Great for study breaks.

name: Botanical Garden
description: Nestled in UCLA's south-east corner, it's a peaceful area to eat lunch, catch up with a friend, or just chill by yourself. Contains turtles, bamboo, and benches.

name: Crow's Nest
description: Look around the top level of Parking Lot 3 and you'll find this chill spot with a clear view of downtown. Best for night

name: Fowler Museum
description: Art and history exhibits. Courtyard is a good place to get away and chill

name: Planetarium Show
description: Free show every Wednesday night

name: Sculpture Garden
description: Random sculptures- good place to lie on the lawn and relax

name: Roofing
description: Good way to spend an evening. List includes: Broad Kerchoff, Boelter/MS, Public Affairs, Physics Astronomy, Ackerman, Pauley, YRL, Folwer, Knudsen, Engr IV, Factor

name: Diddy Riese
description: Classic and cheap. Long lines on weekend nights

name: Restaurants
description: Restaurants such as Bella Pita (falafels), Yamadaya (ramen), 800 degrees (pizza), Fat Sal's (sandwiches), TLT (tacos) and more

name: Persian Square
description: Persian restaurants and stores- try Saffron and Rose for Persian ice cream, Attari for tounge/brain sandwiches, or Shamshiri for Persian food to name a few

name: Sweet Rose Creamery
description: Unique and rich flavors, close drive to campus- also one in Santa Monica off the 2 or 3

name: The Hammer
description: Interesting art exhibits that change constantly. Free entry for students

name: Santa Monica Pier
description: Rides, street vendors, aquarium, view

name: Surf rental
description: Learn how to surf

name: Jungle Gym
description: Adult sized playground with swings, slack lining, rope climbs, etc

name: Beach
description: Chillax. In June, stand in the water at night and feel the thousands of sandcrabs crawl over your feet.

name: DK Donuts and Bakery
description: Wownuts/Conuts (waffle/croissant & donuts), Ube donuts, and more

name: Bay Cities Italian Deli
description: Bomb sandwiches- the godmother is classic

name: AMF Bowling
description: Closest place to campus to bowl. Wait for Groupons to get a deal

name: 3rd and Promenade
description: Upscale/mainstream shops. Street performances happen often from music to acrobatics to dancing

name: Bike path
description: Smooth route for biking/longboarding- Great for summer night bike rides (rentals on 3rd/promenade or UCLA bike shop)

name: Venice Beach
description: Socal beach

name: Vendors
description: Odd and end crafts being sold on the side, medical majiuana cards sold as well for $30/40

name: Abbot Kinney Boulevard
description: Street with stores/cafes catered to the hip

name: Legal Graffiti Wall
description: These walls are constantly changing as different artists come and paint their pieces

name: Muscle Beach
description: Famous for the outdoor workout equipment

name: Skate Park
description: Always full of skaters doing crazy tricks in the bowls and ramps and such

name: Street performances
description: Acrobatics, magic, dancing, and more

name: Wurstkuche
description: Known for their unique sausages with rabbit/rattlesnake/alligator and other meats. Huge variety of German/Belgian beers as well.

name: Canals
description: Good for evening strolls over bridges to pass over canals.

name: Abandoned Nazi Compound
description: Abandoned compound which was built as a Nazi base- now decaying and covered in every changing graffiti art

name: Getty Museum
description: Free entry ($10 parking), view of LA, great if you're into paintings and art, has a garden you can walk through

name: Temescal Canyon
description: Not too easy, not too tough of a hike. Clear view of LA from the top. ~4 miles

name: Self Realization Fellowship Lake Shrine
description: Zen out

name: Muholland Drive
description: Drive through twists and curves on this scenic route in the mountains

name: Inspiration Point
description: Easy hike with another great view of LA at the top ~2.25 miles

name: Restaurants by Sawtelle/Olympic
description: Food everywhere- Ramen- Shinengumi (customizable ramen with different noodle textures and $0.97  noodle refills), Daikokuya (famous for being good), Tonkotsu (Tsukemen ramen, two stores with different broths), Tsujita (order ramen off the iPads) ; Boba/Sweet- Coco's, Volcano Milk Tea, Blockheads (fine shaved ice), Brian's Shaved Ice (Hawaiian shaved ice) ; Curry- Curry house, Hurry Curry ; Sushi Stop- Budget, decent sushi

name: Plan Check
description: Possibly the best burgers in the LA area

name: Churros Calientes
description: Curros cravings

name: Rocky Horror Picture Show
description: Interesting subculture- audience participation, lots of vularity, and live acting along with the movie. Every Saturday night at midnight at Nuart Theater

name: Bonfires
description: Closest legal place to host bonfires. Heads up your feet will be black after walking in the sand as it's right by LAX

name: Getty Villa
description: RSVP for free entry, giant blue pool, statues and art from way back when

name: Malibu Creek Cliff Jumping
description: Popular cliff jumping spot, 3 different levels to jump from

name: Malibu Rindge Dam Cliff Jumping
description: Jumps off of different levels in this dam

name: Malibu Pier
description: Relax along the pier and beach. Fancy houses along the sides of the road

name: Solstice Canyon
description: Solstice Canyon- Waterfall at the end, abandoned manor at the side

name: Point Dume
description: Point Dume Point

name: Escondido Canyon Waterfall
description: Escondido Canyon Waterfall

name: Zuma Beach
description: Well known beach in Malibu

name: Parasailing
description: Get it with a groupon

name: Kayaking
description: Single or tandem kayaking in the Marina. Free if you call in and RSVP as UCLA students

name: Boba Bear
description: Boba and hookah. That is all.

name: Korean Market/Mall
description: Multiple throughout Ktown- kpop stores and markets with pear juice, redbean/icecream fish desserts, kimichi, etc. Location is Galleria, others include Zion and Ktown Plaza

name: Karaoke
description: Singing and drinks; Multiple throughout Ktown- location is Young Dong Nohrenbang

name: KyoChon
description: Korean fried chicken

name: Tom n Toms
description: The Korean Starbucks

name: Korobokur
description: Tea house- hip atmosphere with Miyazaki music, cutesy waitresses, and unique tea dispensers

name: Hwa sun ji
description: Tea house- traditional vibe

name: Blipsy Barcade
description: Drinks and arcade games go hand in hand

name: KBBQ
description: Must for UCLA students. All you can eat ranging from $10 to $20+; favorite low price: Castle II, Bud Namu; and high price: Hae Jang Chon, Road to Seoul (location is budnamu)

name: Ramen (daikokiya, shinsengumi, menoh)
route_notes: 720 ( to commerce center or downtown); 2/302 (to downtown)
description: Daikokiya (hour long waits are the norm), ShinSenGumi (customizable with $0.97 noodle refills), MenOh (classic ramen). Location is Daikokiya

name: Hama Sushi
route_notes: 720 ( to commerce center or downtown); 2/302 (to downtown)
description: Traditional sushi, one of the best in LA. You get what you pay for, with with an average order of sashimi or sushi costing $5-7

name: Mall
route_notes: 720 ( to commerce center or downtown); 2/302 (to downtown)
description: Has a mini arcade, pika-pika photobooth, hype clothing brand stores, bakeries, and restaurants

name: O-Zero
route_notes: 720 ( to commerce center or downtown); 2/302 (to downtown)
description: Milk tea * 720 towards Commerce Center

name: Japanese American National Museum
route_notes: 720 ( to commerce center or downtown); 2/302 (to downtown)
description: Japanese American culture- free every Thurs 5-8, every third Tues

name: Manga & Anime store
route_notes: 720 ( to commerce center or downtown); 2/302 (to downtown)
description: All your childhood animes and mangas

name: Kinokuniya Bookstore
route_notes: 720 ( to commerce center or downtown); 2/302 (to downtown)
description: Chill shop to read animes, random books, and magazines

name: Rodeo Drive
description: Walk around to window shop at stores like Gucchi and Coach

name: Haraujuku
description: For those crepe cravings

name: Icecream Lab
description: Liquid nitrogen icecream- worth a visit to see it made, as it's a bit on the pricey side

name: Velveteria
description: Pieces of art painted on velvet- $10

name: Dimsum
description: Carts rolled around carrying different dim sum dishes- Bao Dim Sum as location.

name: Boba 7
description: Alcoholic boba drinks. Hidden in the back of a thai restaurant

name: Santee Alley
description: Streets are filled with cheap knock-offs, smoking goods, knives, and Mexican street food. The papaya juice at the end of the alley is definitely worth a try

name: Viewpoint
description: 1085 White Knoll Drive- closeup view of downtown

name: LA Gun Club
description: Here's your chance to use firearms- they have a large selection of guns and targets

name: Natural History Museum of LA County
description: Dinosaur bones and other animal exhibits

name: USC
description: Gated school, sketch neighborhood at night

name: California Science Center
description: Visit the space shuttle, Endeavour, at this museum

name: Exposition Rose Garden
description: Large variety of roses and a well-kept lawn to laze around it

name: Underground Subway
description: Old subway system under downtown LA- good luck finding the entrance (not behind Hall of Records though- location is random point)

name: Walt Disney Concert Hall
description: Neat architecture, have a quiet spot in the back with tables and a fountain

name: Central Library
description: Huge library with displays and exhibits inside. Good for studying or escaping the heat

name: LA City Hall Observation Deck
description: View of the city - go up to the 27th floor

name: Museum of Contemporary Art
description: Mordern Art- let your imagination flow. Free every Thurs, 5pm-8pm

name: Grand Central Market
description: Tons of ethnic restaurants and markets from Mexican to Thai to German

name: FIDM Coustume Exhibits
description: Free exhibit of costumes from films and tv shows

name: Bradbury Building
description: Iconic building where movies have been filmed. Interesting architecture to look at

name: Grand Park
description: Park in the middle of downtown- markets and events here on occasions

name: Last Bookstore
description: Independent bookstore with art galleries, book tunnels, and books (of course). They have a $1 book section to appease the thrifty

name: Fashion District
description: Clothing and fabric for discounted prices

name: The Griddle
description: Breakfast food served in huge portions. Like HUGE. Long lines weekend mornings.

name: Laugh Factory
description: Weekly comedy acts, 2 drink minimum- really good first date spot

name: Saddle Ranch
description: Restaurant with a mechanical bull

name: Cabo Cantina
description: Taco Tuesdays- $5 for all you can eat tacos, BOGO beers. Sundays- bottomless mamosas

name: Whipp'd LA
description: Dole Pinapple ice cream is all you need to know

name: Melrose Street
description: Range of odd and end shops, thrift stores- flea markets every Sunday selling random stuff such as polaroid cameras and jewelry

name: Groundlings Show
description: Improv comedy

name: Pink's Hotdogs
description: The original Pink's, hella different types

name: Sonos Studio
description: Free shows, listening parties, and interview sessions- oh, and free booze. Expect lines

name: MILK
description: Dessert and macaroons

name: Paramount Pictures Studio
description: Studio tours

name: Hollywood Forever Cemetery
description: Host outdoor movie screenings every week

name: Runyon Canyon
description: Steep hike up to another view of LA. Lots of abs and yoga pants

name: Canter's Deli
description: Old school food- favorite among many in LA

name: Chibiscus
description: Best brick toast outside the 626

name: Time Mart
description: Odd "time travel" gifts, proceeds help tutor children in writing.

name: Park
description: Good place to relax, can rent a pedal boat to take onto the lake

name: Mohawk Alley Animal Hospital
description: Who doesn't like to play with cute animals

name: LACMA
description: Modern art, random/interesting sculptures and art pieces- good for a day trip. Look for free days, every 2nd Tuesdays, Memorial day

name: La Brea Tar pits
description: History of prehistoric animals that were trapped in the mud pits there

name: Little Ethiopia
description: Have you tried Ethiopian food? Now you can say 'yes'

name: Museum of Tolerance
description: Holocaust memorial museum

name: The Grove
description: Shopping center with upscale stores and street vendors. Also have farmers markets on the regular

name: El Chato
description: Good, cheap Mexican food truck- located at 5300 W Olympic Blvd

name: La Cienega- Restaurant Row
description: Fogo de Chao (Brazillian BBQ), Lawry's, Stinking Rose, etc. Go during Dine LA

name: Kenneth Hahn State Rec Area
description: Chill park to relax in with a view

name: Museum of Jurassic Technology
description: Smoke a bowl before going. Trust me.

name: Honey's Kettle Chicken
description: Bomb fried chicken and biscuits- best eaten with their honey

name: Father's Office
description: Amazing burgers and beers; 21+

name: Baldwin Hills Scenic Overlook
description: Panoramic view of Los Angeles. Parks nearby to play ball or picnic at

name: Sony Pictures Studios
description: TV tapings here. Register early, interesting crowd of people

name: Upright Citizens Brigade Theatre
description: Comedy shows- improv, sketch, and standup

name: Hollywood Bowl
description: Catch a concert here at this amphitheater

name: Walk of Fame
description: It's Hollywood

name: Amoeba Records
description: Huge record store-  $1 CD section if you feel experimental

name: Museum of Death
description: Interesting muesuem with everything dealing with death

name: Universal Citywalk
description: Shops and restaurants

name: Universal Studios
description: Amusement park rides, Horror Nights - discount tickets at CTO

name: Little Armenia
description: Armenian food

name: Mulholland Memorial Fountain
description: Fountain lit up by multicolored lights

name: Abandoned LA Zoo
description: Old LA zoo- can sneak past the fences and walk around the cages

name: Hollywood Sign Hike
description: Classic hike which takes you up to the Hollywood sign

name: Bronson Caves
description: Near the trailhead, these caves were used to film movies such as Batman

name: Griffith Park
description: Hiking trails that go everywhere, from the Hollywood sign to a viewpoint of LA and Giffith Observatory

name: Griffith Observatroy
description: Observatory with planetary exhibits and a view of LA. Popular spot to visit during both day and night

name: Thai Town
description: Pa Ord (bomb noodles/thai tea),

name: Yamashiro Farmer's Market
description: Great view of LA while buying local produce and foods- tacos are a favorite here. Every Thursday in the summer

name: Egyptian Theater
description: Old theater with historic architecture- one of LA's hidden gems
